intro: Corydalis spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leaf corydalis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fumariaceae. It is native to regions of Asia, including China, Korea, and Japan, and thrives in woodland and shaded environments. The plant produces delicate, spurred flowers that are typically pink or purple, with two lobes at the base of the petals. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a hairy texture, contributing to its ornamental value. Corydalis spathulata is valued in horticulture for its attractive blooms and ability to thrive in moist, well-drained soils.
